bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, March 16, 1899
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No. 23, Consular Series. Legation of the United States, March 16, 1899.
Sir: I have the honor to acknwoledge, the receipt, this A. M. of your No. 14, Consulor of Jan. 31, 1899, with inclosures, relative to four indigent American children, in Liberia.
I have to inform you that one of the four children, having died, these are now, only three surviving.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith, M. R. and C. General To Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.
